awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Finite Buildings, Related Geometries and Applications
awd_abstract_narration: Mathematicians from North America and Europe will be                      brought together for a conference in "Finite Buildings, Related                 Geometries and Applications", an area of growing research                       interest.  This subject has its roots in the classification of                  complex Lie groups, but now has connections in many areas of                    mathematics, including discrete groups, finite geometry,                        combinatorics, K-theory, model theory, logic, and computer                      science.  This conference will provide an opportunity for                       interaction between mathematicians of widely varying fields of                  research with a common interest in Finite Buildings.                                    "Finite Buildings" is a relatively new area of                          mathematics, reflecting the tremendous growth of mathematics that               is related to the computerization of modern society.  Practical                 applications are in information storage and retrieval, and in                   computer hardware design.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
